comment: 上課教室在雲和街大樓二樓，地址為雲和街1號(位於雲和小火鍋斜對面、Cafe a la mode正對面)，從師大側門右轉看見Starbucks右轉進入巷子步行約2分鐘(130公尺)，右手邊就會看到雲和街大樓，亦可使用Google Maps APP查詢位置。請同學使用學生證感應，進出雲和街上課教室。
description: This is a 3-point course designed to introduce you to the fundamental principles of second-language acquisition (SLA) research and its implications for language teaching or applied linguistics research. This course addresses second-language (SL) development from an interdisciplinary, multi-dimensional approach and addresses SL development from an interdisciplinary, multi-dimensional approach. The topics covered revolve around studies focusing on the learners' language and development, on internal and external factors affecting SLA, on studies looking at SLA and learner strategies and styles, and finally, on studies relating to SL learning in naturalistic and instructed settings. Throughout the course, the instructor will lead students to explore how the teaching, learning and assessment of second language knowledge (lexical, discourse, pragmatic, grammar) have been conceptualized, researched and explained in recent decades.
goals: to examine how SL instruction has been conceptualized, assessed, researched and explained in recent decades
to consider how SL learners process information and how this impacts language learning
to develop critical thinking skills related to the scholarly inquiry of language instruction, assessment and learning and to how this might impact pedagogical practice
syllabus:
Week 1 Introduction and orientation

Week 2 The language classroom: roles, relationships and interactions

Week 3 Intervening in the language classroom: classroom management, interaction and learning opportunities

Week 4 The language classroom in theory and practice: complex, diverse and local

Week 5 Language, language learning and method: dilemmas and practices

Week 6 Language teaching methods: perspectives and possibilities

Week 7 Theoretical insights for a Postmethod era

Week 8 Midterm presentation I 

Week 9 Midterm presentation II

Week 10 Focus on the language learner: individual attributes and attitudes

Week 11 Learner diversity and development: considerations for the language classroom and beyond

Week 12 Images of language learners: from individual to social, and universal to specific

Week 13 From global trends to local contexts: language dilemmas in the ELT classroom

Week 14 Planning and organizing L2 learning and teaching: contexts and curriculum, possibilities and realities

Week 15 ELT in the world: education and politics, contexts and goals

Week 16 Review and discussion of current ELT issues in Taiwan

Week 17 Final presentation I 

Week 18 Final presentation II

methodologies.note: Problem-based learning from lecture and discussion
Multimedia resources used to enhance understanding
Individual investigation of topics relevant to class lecture
